page.title: 13LANDSCAPE
page.content: This is fairly flat farming country. Many hedges have been removed and therefore many fields are now huge with perhaps the odd tree in the middle of the field marking the line of an old hedge. Many elm trees have died and there are skeletons of those which have not been felled. The crops are barley, oil seed rape and sugar beet. The hedges are ripped into shape by mechanical means. Verges are cut, when County Council funds allow, by the same means. Because of the lack of main through traffic, these lanes often remain uncut and already narrower roads become even more 'narrow' and dangerous because approaching traffic cannot truly judge the edge of the road.
